bug.short_desc: Thunderbird cannot connect to SSL/TLS servers that are restricted to a small set of SHA256/SHA384 cipher suites
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When disable SHA1 on an imaps server thunderbird can't connect to it.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): thunderbird-45.7.0-1.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Every time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. disable sha1 support on the imaps server 2. try to connect to it. 3.
Actual results: No connection
Expected results: working connection
Additional info: Log from server: Mar 10 16:32:33 foo dovecot: imap-login: Disconnected (no auth attempts in 0 secs): user=<>, rip=foo, lip=foo, TLS handshaking: SSL_accept() failed: error:1408A0C1:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_CLIENT_HELLO:no shared cipher, session=<O6wLEmJKzgAgAQRwAG0DAgAAAAAAAAAC>
nmap scan of the server: ORT STATE SERVICE 993/tcp open imaps | ssl-enum-ciphers: | TLSv1.2: | ciphers: | TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (secp384r1) - A | TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 (secp384r1) - A | TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (dh 4096) - A | TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 (dh 4096) - A | compressors: | NULL | cipher preference: server

The same problem connecting to smtp.
server log: warning: TLS library problem: 30135:error:1408A0C1:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_CLIENT_HELLO:no shared cipher:s3_srvr.c:1387
smtp nmap: 25/tcp open smtp | ssl-enum-ciphers: | TLSv1.2: | ciphers: | TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (secp384r1) - A | TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 (secp384r1) - A | TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (dh 4096) - A | TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 (dh 4096) - A | compressors: | NULL | cipher preference: server

Using Thunderbird 45.7 on Fedora 25, I see it offers the following set of ciphers when sending out an SSL/TLS handshake:
cipher_suites[11] = { (0xc02b) TLS/ECDHE-ECDSA/AES128-GCM/SHA256 (0xc02f) TLS/ECDHE-RSA/AES128-GCM/SHA256 (0xc00a) TLS/ECDHE-ECDSA/AES256-CBC/SHA (0xc009) TLS/ECDHE-ECDSA/AES128-CBC/SHA (0xc013) TLS/ECDHE-RSA/AES128-CBC/SHA (0xc014) TLS/ECDHE-RSA/AES256-CBC/SHA (0x0033) TLS/DHE-RSA/AES128-CBC/SHA (0x0039) TLS/DHE-RSA/AES256-CBC/SHA (0x002f) TLS/RSA/AES128-CBC/SHA (0x0035) TLS/RSA/AES256-CBC/SHA (0x000a) SSL3/RSA/3DES192EDE-CBC/SHA }
Apparently there's no overlap with the set of ciphersuites your server offers. Your server has very high requirements.
I assume Fedora enables the same set of ciphersuites that original Mozilla enables.
We should investigate in the upstream bug, if it should enable stronger ones.
should be fixed now when FF52 is out.
